project_name: UPM-2777384 - 3600 Steeles Ave East Markham - EPMS (Powerlogic system) Annual Service
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):rejected by Sebastian Vandervort (3):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Annual EPMS service and Maintenance conducted by Schneider canada. Inspection and maintenance of system integrity and overall performance
scope_of_work.scope:
Schneider electric to conduct service as follows:
-PC health
-Database maintenance
-Communications
-Diagrams
-Alarms
-Field Device maintenance
-Backups
scope_of_work.justification:
Electrical Power Management Systems (EPMS) provides visibility into complex and dynamic networks from the electric utility service points and alternate energy sources all the way to critical loads.

Not included in the contract. It is discretionary spend. Recommended by CBRE.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: System health could be overlooked and lead to future faults.

project_name: UPM-2768891 - 275 Viger, Montreal - Déplacement de 2 tuyaux en avant du STS-B
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Maureen Gerlach (2):work order closed by Maureen Gerlach (3):work planning by Maureen Gerlach (4):offer approved by Maureen Gerlach (5):offer submitted by Maureen Gerlach

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Deux tuyaux situés à l'avant du STS-B limitent considérablement l'accès pour effectuer la maintenance annuel du STS-B. Ces tuyaux doivent être déplacés pour permettre le bon accès au technicien STS
scope_of_work.scope:
Enlèvement de deux coudes avec isolant contenant de l’amiante (méthode sacs à gant).
- Travaux de plomberie (déviation des conduits d’environ deux pieds vers la gauche tel qu’entendu).
- Calorifugeage de plomberie.
- Démolition de la base de béton au 5e
étage (à la base des conduits).
- Scan de dalle.
- Deux nouveaux percements de plancher (travaux de jour).
- Ragréage du plancher avec peinture époxy standard au 5e
étage.
- Démolition du mur de gypse et terracotta au 4e
étage.
- Scellant coupe-feu.
- Refermer mur de gypse au 4e
étage avec cloison de puit en système intérieur.
- Peinture au 5e
étage.
- Réinstaller la plinthe de tapis existante.
- Protection temporaire pour les travaux.
- Nettoyage de fin de travaux
- Supervision de T3P Construction inc.
scope_of_work.justification: Pour finaliser l'entretien annuel du STS-B on a besoin de déplacer ces 2 tuyaux pour la performande du STS-B
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: la maintenance n'est pas completer d'ou s,il y a une intervention au niveau du panneau de STS-B on peux pas règlé le problème d'ou le risque pout le data center DC4

project_name: UPM-2778234 - 3600 Steeles Ave East Markham - Chillers GXT UPS's Batteries replacement
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):rejected by Sebastian Vandervort (3):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: DC GROUP to replace all chillers control panels GXT UPS Batteries due to its age and years of service. This requirement follows alert 003-13
scope_of_work.scope: GXT UPS's supporting all three Chillers control panels will be replaced by DC GROUP. This replacement will take place on one chiller at a time to ensure N+1 availability
scope_of_work.justification: VRLA batteries in these particular modules are recommended for replacement at a range of 3 - 5 years of service, This battery system with age loses its ability to maintain greater than 80% capacity, Replacement is recommended
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: As these batteries age, a decline on its rating is also impacted. This decline could be a result of internal corrosion and expansion of the plate grids, possible drying of the electrolytes. Naturally the batteries no longer will support the load as per its design specs.

project_name: UPM-2777232 - 275 Viger, Montreal - AC datadomain VxRails
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):work order closed by Sebastian Vandervort (3):work planning by Sebastian Vandervort (4):offer approved by Sebastian Vandervort (5):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.scope:
Need supply and install two power bars by the vendor.
The vendor need to confirm if 460R9W is correct receptcal for the power bar. If not corrent, please correct.

Need two APC AP8867. APC Rack PDU, 2G, metered, 0U, 17.2kW, 208V, 30 C13 sockets.
Main Input Voltage 3 phase
Main Output Voltage 208 V
plug standard IEC 60309 60 A 3P+PE

1. Turn off / Open the breaks of X83Y21
2. Unplug the plugs of the power bar
3. De-energized work for new power installation at X83Y21.
4. Install the new 60A breaks,whips and conectors (460R9W).
5. Install the new power bars at X83Y21.
5. Turn on the breaks and connect the power bars.
6. Testing the new insallation of the power.
